item.title: John 1
item.description:
John Chapter 1

1In the beginning the Word was there. The Word was with God, and the Word was deity. 2He was in the beginning with God. 3He made everything; nothing was made without him. 4He had life in himself, and the life was light for mankind. 5The light shined in the darkness, but the darkness did not accept it.

6God sent a man named John 7to testify about the light so everybody would believe through him. 8He wasn’t the light, but came to testify about 9the true light that enlightens every person by coming into the world. 10He was in the world and made the world, but the world didn’t know him. 11He came into his own things, but his own people did not accept him. 12But, to as many as did accept him he gave the right to become God’s children—the ones that trust in him. 13They were not born from the will of a husband, from physical drives, or from blood, but from God.

item.title: John 2
item.description:
John Chapter 2

1Three days later there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there, 2and Jesus and his disciples were invited. 3When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They don’t have any more wine.”

4Jesus said, “What’s between you and me? It’s not my time yet.”

5His mother told the help, “Do whatever he tells you.”

6Now six large stone water pots were standing there, used for purification by the Jews, holding twenty or thirty gallons apiece. 7Jesus said, “Fill the pots with water,” and they filled them to the brim. 8“Dip some out now, and take it to the master of ceremonies.” 9When the master of ceremonies tasted the water turned to wine, he didn’t know where it came from—but the help that drew the water knew. He called the groom, 10“Everybody serves good wine first. When people have drunk freely, they serve wine that’s not as good. You’ve kept the good wine till now.” 11So Cana was where Jesus performed his first sign and demonstrated his glory, and his disciples believed in him. Jn 2:1-11

item.title: John 3
item.description:
John Chapter 3

1A man named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews, 2came to Jesus at night and said, “Rabbi, we know you’re a teacher from God; nobody can do the signs you do unless God’s with him.”

3Jesus answered him, “Unless a person is born again, he can’t see the kingdom of God.”

4Nicodemus said, “How can a person be born when he is old? He can’t enter his mother’s womb a second time and be born, can he?”

item.title: John 4
item.description:
John Chapter 4

1When Jesus found out that the Pharisees heard he himself was making and baptizing more disciples than John 2(though Jesus didn’t perform the baptisms himself; his disciples were doing it), 3he left Judaea and headed back to Galilee. 4He needed to go through Samaria. 5He came to a town in Samaria called Sychar near the plot of land Jacob gave his son Joseph. 6Jacob’s well was there. Jesus was sitting on the well, tired from the trip. It was about noon.

item.title: John 5
item.description:
John Chapter 5

1After this came a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. 2At the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem there was a pool with five porches called Bethesda in Hebrew. 3In these porches lay a crowd of infirm, blind, lame, and paralyzed people. [4] 5One fellow there had been in his condition for thirty-eight years.

6When Jesus saw him and knew he’d already been there a long time, he said, “Are you wanting to be cured?”

item.title: John 6
item.description:
John Chapter 6

1After this Jesus went away beyond the Sea of Galilee (Sea of Tiberias). 2A large crowd followed him, because they saw the signs he was doing on the sick. 3He went up on a hill and sat down with his disciples. 4The Passover feast of the Jews was coming. 5Then Jesus looked up and saw a large crowd arriving, and said to Philip, “Where will we buy bread so these can eat?” 6(He said this to test him, because he knew what he was going to do.)

item.title: John 7
item.description:
John Chapter 7

1After this, Jesus traveled around Galilee. He didn’t want to travel in Judaea because the Jews were trying to kill him.

Jn 7:1

2The Jews’ Feast of Unleavened Bread was coming. 3So Jesus’ brothers said to him, “Go to Judaea so your disciples can see what you can do. 4Nobody does something in private when he’s trying to be known publicly. If you’re doing these things, show yourself to the world.” 5(Not even his brothers believed in him.)

item.title: John 8
item.description:
John Chapter 8

18: Jesus at the Feast of Dedication

2The Feast of Dedication took place in Jerusalem during the winter, 23and Jesus was walking in the temple in Solomon’s Portico. 24The Jews surrounded him and said, “How long are you going to hold us in suspense? Are you the Messiah? Tell us plainly.”

5Jesus answered, “I’ve told you, and you don’t believe me. The things I do in my Father’s name testify for me. 26But you don’t believe me, because you’re not my sheep. 27My sheep hear my voice, and I know them. They follow me, 28and I give them eternal life. Nobody will snatch them out of my hand. 29My Father, who gave them to me, is more powerful than anybody. Nobody will snatch them out of the Father’s hand. 30The Father and I are at one.”

item.title: John 9
item.description:
John Chapter 9

10: Plots to Kill Jesus

5Many Jews that came to Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him; 46but some went to the Pharisees and told them what he’d done. 47So the high priests and the Pharisees convened the Sanhedrin, “What are we going to do? This man is doing lots of signs. 48If we leave him alone like this, everybody’s going to believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away our place and our nation.”

item.title: John 10
item.description:
John Chapter 10

1After he said this, Jesus began to feel distraught, “I tell you, one of you is going to betray me.”

2The disciples looked at one another at a loss who he. 23One disciple was reclining at table in front of Jesus—the one Jesus loved. 24Simon Peter motioned to him to find out who Jesus 25So he leaned back on Jesus’ chest from where he was and said, “Lord, who is it?”

item.title: John 11
item.description:
John Chapter 11

1There was a sick man, Lazarus of Bethany, the village of Mary and Martha her sister. 2This was the Mary that anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair. Lazarus was her brother. 3His sisters sent to Jesus, “Lord, the one you love is sick.”

4When he heard it, he said, “This sickness isn’t to death; it’s for the glory of God so the Son of God can be glorified by it.”

item.title: John 12
item.description:
John Chapter 12

1Six days before the Passover Jesus arrived at Bethany, where Lazarus was that Jesus had raised from the dead. 2They made him a meal there. Martha was waiting on him and Lazarus was one of those reclining at table with him. 3Mary took twelve ounces of ointment—pure nard, very expensive—and poured it on Jesus’ feet and started wiping them with her hair. The scent from the ointment filled the whole house.

item.title: John 13
item.description:
John Chapter 13

1Before the Passover feast, Jesus knew the time had come to go to the Father. He loved his own who were in the world, and loved them to the end. 2By the time of the supper, the devil had put it in the heart of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, to betray him. 3Jesus knew the Father had placed everything in his hands. 4He got up from supper, laid his outer clothes aside, and took a towel and hung it over himself. 5Then he put some water in a washbasin, and started to wash his disciples’ feet, and dry them with the towel.

item.title: John 14
item.description:
John Chapter 14

1“Don’t worry. You believe in God; believe in me too. 2There are many rooms in my Father’s house. If it weren’t so, I would’ve told you, because I’m going to get a place ready for you. 3If I go to do that, I’ll come back and get you so you can be where I am. 4You know the way to get to where I am.”

5Thomas said, “We don’t know where you’re going; how can we know the way to get there?” 6“I am the way, the truth, and the life. Nobody comes to the Father except through me. 7If you know me, you know my Father too. From now on you know him and have seen him.”

item.title: John 15
item.description:
John Chapter 15

1“I’m the true vine; my Father is the vinedresser. 2He takes out every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit. Every branch that does bear fruit he prunes so it’ll bear more fruit. 3Already you are pruned by the word I’ve spoken to you. 4Remain in me and I in you. A branch can’t bear fruit by itself unless it remains in the vine; neither can you unless you remain in me. 5I’m the vine; you’re branches. Whoever remains in me and I in him bears lots of fruit. Without me you can’t do anything. 6f anybody does not remain in me, he’s taken out like a branch. It dries up, and they gather it up and throw it in the fire and it’s burned up. 7 If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask for whatever you want and you’ll receive it. 8This is what honors my Father: your bearing lots of fruit and becoming my disciples. 9As the Father has loved me, I’ve loved you. Remain in my love. 10If you keep my commandments, you’ll be remaining in my love as I’ve kept my Father’s commandments and remain in his love. 11“I’ve said this so you can have the complete joy I have. 12This is my commandment: love one another as I’ve loved you. 13Nobody has greater love than this: to lay down his life for his friends. 14You’re my friends if you do what I tell you. 15I don’t call you servants anymore, because a servant doesn’t know what his master’s doing. I call you friends because I tell you everything I’ve heard from my Father. 16You didn’t choose me; I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit that lasts, so my Father will give you whatever you ask for in my name. 17I command you these things so you’ll love one another. 18“If the world hates you, understand that it hated me first. 19If you were like the world, it would love its own kind. But because you’re not like the world, it hates you—but I’ve chosen you out of the world. 20Remember what I told you, ‘A servant’s not better off than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they’ll persecute you. If they kept my word, they’ll keep yours. 21They’ll do this to you because of me, because they don’t know the One that sent me. 22“If I hadn’t come and spoken to them, they wouldn’t have any sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin. 23Whoever hates me also hates my Father. 24If I hadn’t done among them what no one else has done, they wouldn’t have any sin; but now they’ve seen and have hated both me and my Father. 25But, they’ve done this in fulfillment of what’s written in their law, ‘They hated me for no reason.’ 26“When the Helper comes that I’ll send from the Father—the Spirit of truth who proceeds from him, he’ll bear witness of me. 27You’ll bear witness too, because you’ve been with me from the beginning.

item.title: John 16
item.description:
John Chapter 16

1“I’ve told you this so you won’t get caught off guard. 2They’ll excommunicate you from the synagogues, but—more than that—the time’s coming when anybody that kills you will think he’s serving God. 3They’ll do it because they don’tknow the Father or me. So when it happens, remember that I told you it would. 4“I didn’t tell you these things at first, because I was with you. 5But now I’m going to the One that sent me, and none of you needs to ask, ‘Where are you going?’ 6Because I’ve told you, sorrow has filled your heart. 7But I tell you the truth, it’s to your benefit that I go away. If I don’t, the Helper won’t be coming to you. If I go, I’ll send him. 8When he comes, he’ll convict the world of sin and righteousness and judgment—9of sin, because they don’t believe in me; 10of righteousness, because I’m going to the Father and you won’t see me anymore; 11and of judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged. 12“I still have so much to tell you, but you can’t deal with it now. 13But when the Spirit of truth comes, he’ll lead you into all truth. He won’t speak on his own, but will tell you what he has heard, and will inform you about what is coming. 14He’ll honor me because he’ll take from me to tell you. 15Everything the Father has is mine. That’s why I’ve said the Spirit will take from me to tell you. 16“In a little while you won’t see me; and again in a little while you’ll see me.”

item.title: John 17
item.description:
John Chapter 17

1Jesus looked up to heaven, “Father, it’s time. Honor your Son so he can honor you. 2You gave him authority over everybody so he could give eternal life to everybody you’ve given him. 3Eternal life means knowing you, the only true God, and Jesus the Messiah, the One you sent. 4I’ve honored you on the earth and completed the work you gave me to do. 5Now, honor me and yourself with the honor I had with you before the earth existed. 6“I’ve shown you to the ones you gave me out of the world, and they’ve kept your word. 7 Now they know that the message I’ve given them came from you, 8and they’ve received it. They know truly that I came from you, and believe you sent me. 9I’m not asking about the world, but about the ones you gave me. 10My things are yours and yours are mine, and I’ve been honored in them. 11I’m not in the world anymore, but they’re in the world and I’m coming to you. Holy Father, keep them in your name so they can be one like we are. 12When I was with them, I kept them in your name, and none of them has perished except the son of perdition—to fulfill scripture. 13I’m saying these things so they can fully experience my joy. 14The world hates them because they’re not of the world. 15I’m not asking you to take them out of it, but to keep them from the evil one. 16They’re not of the world as I’m not of the world. 17I’ve sanctified them with the truth—with your word. 18As you sent me into the world, I’ve sent them into the world. 19I’ve sanctified myself for them so the truth can sanctify them. 20“Father, I’m not asking just that these be one, but that those also be one who believe in me through their word, 21so the world can know you sent me. 22I’ve given them the honor you gave me so they can be one like us—23so the world may know you love them like you love me. 24I want them to be with me where I am so they can see the honor you gave me because you loved me before the the world existed. 25“Righteous Father, the world didn’t know you, but I knew you, and these know you sent me. 26I’ll continue to make you known to them so the love you loved me with may be in them as I am in them.”

item.title: John 18
item.description:
John Chapter 18

1When Jesus finished, he went out with his disciples past the valley Kidron to an orchard. 2Judas knew about the place, because Jesus often went there with his disciples. 3Judas had received a cohort as well as officers of the chief priests and Pharisees, and went there with lanterns, torches, and weapons. 4Jesus knew what was coming on him, and went out to them, “Who are you looking for?” 5“Jesus the Nazarene.” “I’m Jesus.” Judas was standing with them. 6When he said, “I’m Jesus,” they shrank back and fell to the ground.

item.title: John 19
item.description:
John Chapter 19

1Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged. 2The soldiers twisted thorns together to make a crown, and put it on his head. They put a purple robe on him, 3and started coming up to him and saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!” and slapping him.

4Pilate brought him out again, “I’m bringing him out to let you know I don’t find him guilty of anything.” 5So he brought Jesus out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. “Look at the man!”

item.title: John 20
item.description:
John Chapter 20

1On the first day of the week, Mary the Magdalene came to the tomb early while it was still dark, and saw the stone rolled away from the tomb. 2So she ran to Simon Peter and the disciple Jesus loved, “They’ve taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they put him.”

3So Peter and the other disciples ran to the tomb; 4the other disciple outran Peter and got there first. 5He stooped down and saw the linen wrappings lying there, but didn’t go in.

item.title: John 21
item.description:
John Chapter 21

1After this, Jesus appeared again to his disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. This is what happened. 2Together were Simon Peter, Thomas, Nathanael from Cana of Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples.

3Simon Peter said, “I’m going fishing.” “We’ll go with you.” They went out and got in the boat, and that night they didn‘t catch anything. 4When morning was coming, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not know it was Jesus. 5“Children, you haven’t had anything to eat, have you?” “No.” 6“Cast the net on the right side of the boat and you’ll find some.” So they cast it, and they weren’t strong enough to haul it in because ot the number of fish.
